localised_description: I must return to Castle Drakenhof and study these books further. My sire will surely relinquish his claim once he witnesses my newfound power. If not... then he will suffer the same fate as the Devils of Swartzhafen.
These dunes still hide many treasures. My business is not concluded here.
Sylvania is presently of no concern. I must focus my efforts elsewhere.
Completing a route will count as a campaign victory and will trigger the achievements. Do not worry, you still will be able to keep playing to complete the other routes or go for a world domination!
The journey from Bordeleaux to Bregonne is usually fraught with danger, but for the Bretonnians the seas are as smooth as glass and the wind forever in their sails.
Wherever Alberic does battle, his enemies are forced to reckon with whirlpools, tidal waves, foul weather and scores of creatures of the deep.
Alberic has supped from the grail, becoming a god amongst men.
The peasants are safe. Have them return to their labours, for idle hands are the daemon's playthings.
The scourge of undeath has been banished from the waves. Manann is pleased.
Taurox has risen to the pinnacle of Khorne's favour. Even the foremost of the Blood God's daemons are forced to serve in his warherds.

From Naggaroth to Lustria, all are prey, hunted for sport by the Slaughterhorn tribe. The strands of fate have been cut to shreds by Taurox's rune-tortured axes, and those who were once destined to bring him low now lay dead beneath his bloodsoaked hooves.

The Slaughterhorn tribe enact hideous rites at the Heart of the Dark, feeding thousands of captives into a gaping, gnashing maw at the very foundation of the herdstone. Men suffer evil dreams. Priests are plagued with temptation. Every beast feels a primal urge to kill and destroy, and the Cloven Ones march to war.

With a pulse of eldritch force, the Crown of Domination is placed upon your head. A vast ocean of battle-hardened warriors chants your name. You take up your blade and mount your steed, ready to march south to bring ruination and death to the world.

The Slayer of Kings is a huge sword with the raging soul of a captive Greater Daemon, U'zuhl, bound within it. Archaon claimed it from the hands of the Father of the Dragon Ogres, giving Archaon a weapon that has drunk the blood of kings for aeons. Now, he must decide U'zuhl's fate.
I said I would set you free, mighty daemon. I never said when.
You are free, daemon. Free to serve as my pack mule. Now go, search the corpses of the slain. Bring back anything of value you find.
Deep beneath Middenheim there lies an ancient device, left from the age when the gods warred against the Old Ones; a device that, if properly coaxed, will unleash a rift to the Realm of Chaos.
This moondail once belonged to Captain Jaego Roth, before he was slain by Count Noctilus. It enables its owner to pull of seemingly-impossible feats of navigation and piloting.
Do you know what Aranessa Saltspite, Queen of the Pirates, did when the treasure she had sought was placed in front of her very eyes? She laughed.

Those amongst Aranessa's crew who believe her to be the daughter of Manann fight with a bravado that is rarely seen upon the sun-baked timbers of a man'o'war.  After all, who else upon the seas can claim they share the favour of a god?

Whether through Manann's divine intervention or simple chance, the floating carcasses of mighty sea beasts are a common sight for the sailors of the Swordfysh. The vampires pledged to the Pirate Queen's service waste no time reanimating the creatures and commanding them to follow in the ship's wake.
I want every gun we have to fire on that man.

localised_title: The Red Book of Van Hel
localised_description: As the Sartosans pillaged the rapidly sinking Bloody Reaver, one of their number came across this ancient tome. Upon touching it, they collapsed into ash. A Vampire Fleet Captain quickly recognised its importance and ensured its knowledge was not lost beneath the waves.
From the highest tower in the City of Smoke the Supreme Matriarch safeguards the nation.
Across Cathay the merchants rejoice, for the trade routes are secure and wealth flows into the nation.
With the daemons kept at bay, the land thrives and the people are content.
Diplomats from the west brave the Ivory Road to kneel before the Dragon Emperor and pledge their nations to his cause.

Cultists continue to desperately chant their ritual of binding, even as the last of their defenders are cut down. Something vast roars from deep within the Dark Fortress, and a burst of blinding light briefly turns night to day. Miao dares not hope...
With Shen-Zoo safely returned, light shines on the Celestial Empire once more. The people rejoice and the shadows are banished.
Great was Shen-Zoo's fury against the servants of Chaos who had imprisoned her. Mortal warriors were torn apart by tooth and claw; legions of daemons were banished with her holy light.
The Dragon Emperor and Moon Empress are one step closer to bringing their plan to fruition, but not even their children know what that plan is.

There's more than iron in Zhao Ming's blood. He rules a province too close to the Ogre's mouth - a land blighted by fell minerals and overrun by cloaked vermin. It's got to him! His sisters know, his brothers suspect... but his mother, the Empress, will not let anyone besmirch his name.
First Kislev, then the world. All will bow before my dark majesty!
Rage and humiliation burning in his soul, Be'lakor places the Crown of Domination upon your brow and kneels before you, the true Everchosen.
Ursun is dead. The Daemon Prince finally has what Be'lakor's lying tongue once promised: the fathomless power of a God.
The nation mourns, for their queen has fallen before the Daemon Prince...
The Winds of Magic surge with newfound strength as the ancient Slann's still-beating heart is crushed in your grip. Khaine's bloodlust is sated... for now.
With the tear in reality now free to grow unchecked, legions of the Dark Prince's daemons pour through the breach.
This jewel was originally gifted to Morathi by Aenarion, before it was stolen by Anar. It cloaks the wearer in shadow.
From Ghrond's pinnacle, Sorceresses of the Dark Convent manipulate the Winds of Magic in Morathi's favour.
The Hag Queen deliberately withholds the deepest secrets of the Cauldrons of Blood, thus chaining the Witch Elves to her will.
Khaine's Fury rages within these blades but his power comes at a price.
Such a brutal sacrifice leaves a mark upon the world, and they cannot help but see it and recoil in horror. They fear us now, and we will feel that fear on the battlefield.
Look at them, they're pathetic... Once so proud but broken so easily. Put them to work in the pens, quickly!
The Druchi cannot help but stare in wonder and envy. The Crone has slain the Queen and Ulthuan is ablaze. They come, bowing low, gifts raised above their heads.
The Cauldron so long denied to me is finally mine. From the very first sip I am renewed, Crone no longer.
No vengeance can ever taste as sweet as slaying Morathi., and no sacrifice to Drakira ever be as powerful... No matter, I have earned Drakira's favour today.

Malekith proved that the Elgi cannot be trusted. It is in their nature to lie and decieve, and the Dawi would be fools to forget this. The War of Vengeance will begin anew, and this time it will not end until we have their unconditional surrender. Muster the throngs - we march to Ulthuan!
The Grudge is struck. The Witch King's veiled machinations have been laid bare for all to see. Let us reforge the old alliances and stand together as one against the coming darkness.
The Witch King is dead, turned to stone by Grungi's judgment. His hateful empire is in ruins, and his great betrayal has finally been avenged.
The Isle of Ulthuan boasts treasures that rival even the greatest dwarfholds of the Everlasting Realm.
The White Dwarf has laid the foundation for a new Dwarfen realm amongst the snowy peaks of Naggaroth. May the Ancestor Gods watch over these trailblazers until their dying days!
Nakai didn't wander far enough. His head now takes pride of place in the Huntmarshal's trophy room.

Arise, Huntsmarshal. You need not kneel in my presence; you have earned that right. Your expedition has brought honour and glory to the Empire in its hour of greatest need. Your brother would be proud.
This ancient artifact glows with an eldritch light, filling one's mind with a bestial fury.
Marienburg's independence is no more. Rulership has been returned to the true Duke of Marienburg, Theoderic Gausser, and the wealth from its ports now flows into the imperial coffers once more.

Upon the battlements of Castle Drakenhof, the Emperor slew Vlad von Carstein in personal combat, staking him through the heart to ensure he would never return. The Cleansing of Sylvania has begun, though it will take many years to purge these blighted lands.

Whether through conquest or diplomacy, the Empire has gained newfound strength with which to wield against its rivals. Even Sigmar Heldenhammer himself did not command such martial and political strength in his lifetime.
After clubbing Greasus to death with his own sceptre and banishing Kholek from the mountains, the Ogres saw Grimgor as a living avatar of the Great Maw and pledged their allegiance.

With the combined might of the Greenskin and Ogre races, Grimgor cracked the Great Bastion of Cathay and burned the Dragon-fleets of Nippon. The Far East became green, and Da Immortulz soon grew to become masters at predicting and ambushing Cathayan caravan routes.
The Dawi-Zharr have reaped what they have sown. They are now slaves to Grimgor, doomed to labour at their forges to produce arms and armour for his ever-growing Waaagh!
“Dis way, ladz! I 'eard Ironhide's 'aving anuver big stunty bake!”
“Dat's right 'umie, get ma choppa nice 'n frosty.”
Wot's dis do?
Not since the Age of Colonisation have the Elves known such prosperity.
With the Witch King's demise, revolts have broken out across Naggaroth. Thousands of slaves and druchii defectors flee the Black Cities, and some even flock to your banner.
Ostensibly the progeny of the Everqueen and the Phoenix King, some whisper that Aliathra's pedigree is... less than certain.
After centuries of isolation, the Asrai now answer to the Phoenix King and the Elves of Ulthuan.
Tyrion has reclaimed the original Phoenix Crown, which was stolen by the Dwarf King Gotrek Starbreaker at the Battle of the Three Towers. This aching wound to High Elf pride can finally heal.
The world is in flames, broken and crumbling. The Exile has served his purpose.
Skarbrand's Blood Hosts sweep across the land, drowning the world in blood.
Khorne sits resplendent in his rage upon the Skull Throne, pleased with your offering. But, of course, he is never satisfied. He demands more. More! MORE!
Against all the evil that Chaos can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce, we will send unto them... only you.
Against all the evil that Chaos can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce, we will send unto them... only you.
Be'lakor and Kislev's fallen son are dead. Ursun's godly wrath ensured their souls never made it back to the Realms of Chaos. Never again will they threaten Kislev.
The End Times have been averted. The greatest champions the Dark Gods could muster were no match for the Red Tzar and his fearsome mount.
The Chaos Dwarfs and their thrall Orcs were undone by a most unexpected foe - a great Kislevite host emerging out of the Chaos Wastes.
The lands of Kislev now stretch from west to east, a great bastion of ice and steel harkening back to the glory days of old. Long live the Motherland!
The Motherland, now united in purpose, sends the Red Tzar's armies much needed foodstuff, ammunition and, most important of all - kvas!
Does that hurt, comrade? I'm sorry; Sasha doesn't know his own strength sometimes. Please believe that I will learn what you're hiding from me; when I do, our next meeting will not be so pleasant.

The Mad Monk has bent the knee, claiming a vision from Ursun revealed to him the error of his ways. Perhaps this is true, or perhaps he simply realises he has lost the support of the people. Whatever the case, his zealous followers will be of great value in the wars to come.
The tears I might have shed for your dark fate... grow cold, and turn to tears of hate!
Though hordes of savage Chaos worshippers have been put to route, countless more descend from the north, held at bay only by the might of Kislev. The Tzarina calls for aid, but who will answer?

King Louen Leoncoeur answered the call without hesitation, pledging a tenth of Bretonnia's hardier steeds to Kislev's cause. Though the Royarch must contend with his own troubles at home, he vows that Kislev will not face this threat alone.
Death-seeking dwarfs from Slayer Keep journey to Kislev in droves, chanting their deathsongs and loudly declaring the superiority of Bugman's Ale over the local kvas to anyone who will listen.
Baggage trains loaded with firearms and artillery wind their way north from the foundries of Nuln, a show of support from the Empire.

A solemn procession of Elven mages arrives at Kislev's gates in the dead of night, sent by the Warden of the White Tower of Hoeth. They stand ready to fight alongside the Defenders of the World once more.
The Ice Queen's ruinous leadership will lead Kislev astray no longer. The Motherland is stronger for it.

The Supreme Patriarch knows without a shadow of a doubt that the only thing that stands between his people and annihilation is faith. A bright reflection of the dark sorcerers and champions of Chaos, he sees the land around him and Ursun as what he must protect and serve.
You follow a great man, but he is just a man. Follow the bear, and you will know true strength.
The followers of Handrich now see that the one true path to salvation lies through the renunciation of all wealth, preferably to the Patriarchs of the Great Orthodoxy.
The wolf and the bear must stand together to brave the coming storm. The Great Orthodoxy will ensure such a union perseveres.
Rejoice, peasants. The fires of Dazh have exposed your masters for what they truly were. Feed the flames, and your salvation will be ensured.
The interlopers have been purged. The Skink artisans and Kroxigor labourers can continue their work unabated.
The Hag Queen and her cruel consorts have met their end, their souls now the playthings of the Ancient Enemy for all eternity. The arcane artifacts contained within Quintex are now at your disposal.
The Geomantic Web thrums with power, the spawning pools thrash with new life - all is as the Old Ones foretold.

Seafang's figurehead greedily absorbed the blood of the slain challengers smeared upon it. The ship now thrums with an eldritch power that has spread across Wulfrik's entire fleet, filling their sails with the Winds of Magic.
Baleful monuments to your dark master poison the land and whip the Winds of Magic up into a hurricane gale, allowing hordes of daemons to manifest directly into the mortal realm.

With his Gift of Tongues, Wulfrik curses foes and goads them into recklessness. Whether he's besmirching a Dwarf's honour, questioning a Bretonnian's lineage or humiliating a haughty Elf - none can ignore his insults for long.
We fought monsters. And we became them.
The Norscans of Lustria have taught Wulfrik's warriors how to harvest and coat their blades in deadly poisons from the jungles.

Nurgle's Chaos Cults rot the the world, weakening the strength of the armies of mortals and the morale of their civilian subjects. A single cough can lay low a legendary hero where feats of arms have failed. A sneeze can decimate an entire town. Where subtle measures fail, cultists can rip apart the veil between reality and the Realm of Chaos, summoning Nurgle's Daemons to lay waste with their contagions. As pestilence grips the world, Nurgle's power eclipses that of his brother gods.
The aged Necromancer's resilience to toxins rivals those of Poxfulcrum herself. This delights Ku'gath to no end, as he makes an excellent subject for which to test his latest creations.

Ku'gath took great delight in visiting the many sights and cities of Grand Cathay, showing his appreciation by sharing the many gifts he had created. In the southern and western provinces, crops withered, rice paddies were blighted, and the people took ill. They called him Zin-Fa and prayed to him for salvation. He was only too happy to oblige...

Ku'gath's newest creation runs rampant through the oblasts. Brave Kossars stumble and fall, their blood crystalising in their veins, their hearts pierced in a hundred different places by the tiny shards. The Ice Witches suffer the most; their corpses nightmares to behold: great shards of ice emerging from gaping mouths and bloody eye sockets.

Ku'gath once spent several centuries within the Forge of Souls as punishment for his failure against the Dwarfs. Yet the Urfather was always a forgiving father towards his children. This recent victory has raised Ku'gath to the pinnacle of Nurgle's favour once more.

Ku'gath, ever generous with his children, gifted them with his newest creation, derived from the pollutants found within the River Ruin. The Nurglings are soon overjoyed to discover their skin hardening like iron from this new gift.

Greasus' wealth is now so obscene that even the lowliest Gnoblar in his tribe is bedecked in finery that would beggar a noble. All vie to join the Goldtooths and share in their wealth, and even the great nations of the world are enticed by the Hoardmaster's lucrative offers.

In recognition of Greasus' indisputable dominion over these lands, the Black Dwarfs of Zhar-Naggrund have gifted him with a powerful daemon engine to strap to the back of his cart. In return, they merely ask that he look the other way when the occasional Cathayan caravan goes missing...

Grimgor's armour was forged in the blood of Dwarf Runepriests, thus granting it potent defensive properties. As it was far too small for Greasus' magnificent bulk, it was melted down and reforged into a gut-plate of terrific proportions.

The Cathayans have now accepted their place at the Overtyrant's feet. Caravans journey to his Great Hall laden with gold, gemstones and exotic meats, hoping to barter for safe passage across the Ivory Road. Each season, their profit margins grow smaller.
The Prophet's revelation came as he journeyed to both locations. The Great Maw was one god of two aspects, a mighty beast who would one day gorge itself on the whole world.
Skrag returns to the almighty God Mouth and pays the necessary tribute: a veritable mountain of meat harvested from those foolish enough to stand in his way.

The Great Maw's greatest prophet has founded a new Ogre Kingdom in the very heartland of Bretonnia. The Land of Chivalry is now anything but, and the Lady of the Lake has seemingly deserted her people, though some claim that she was dragged screaming into Skrag's maw-cauldron...

The Great Maw's greatest prophet has founded a new Ogre Kingdom in the centre of the Empire. This once mighty nation of men is now naught but livestock for the Ogre tribes who now call these lands their own.
The Gorgers have feasted well. Their mutated forms now ripple with power, a clear sign of the Great Maw's blessing.
Sneek and the Deathmaster have expanded Eshin's Trials as more capable candidates pass their tests and are granted the Master Assassin title.
Ku'gath and his plagues are no longer infecting this world with their foul stench, but some of his treasure survived the purge - strange potions and barely legible notes among the spoils.
Ironhammer and his ghosts did not see us coming, and they paid the ultimate price. The Council will demand a great price from the Goblins, that much is certain.
We could not kill it, it was too strong. It needed a new host after Darkblade was slain... It found one.
Snikch's blades have slaughtered so many yet remain so impressively sharp. The Clans pray to the Horned Rat that those blades do not turn their way next.
Our Assassins have studied the Vampire's movement - we know now how they fight, and we'll use that against the rest of their kind.
Cross-breeding all manner of creatures and utilising the mutating effects of warpstone, Throt is ever seeking to create more destructive creatures to set on his enemies and trade with other clans.
Winding lines of corpse-wagons journey towards Hell Pit, ensuring Throt's gluttonous creations have a constant supply of flesh to sate their ravenous appetites.
Like a squished moth, Ariel is now nothing but a pulp consumed by Throt to abate his hunger, with the remains used to augment his twisted hench-rats!

The Mage-Queen's pulped remains have been bottled into hundreds of vials, each one worth a small fortune in warpstone. Envoys from every clan in Skavendom journey to Hell Pit in the hopes of acquiring the precious substance.
These frozen corpses will make for excellent sources of mutagen with which to bolster the ferocity of the Master Mutator's creations.
With the Mage-Queen's demise, Throt prepares to harvest her divine flesh...

The Dark Prince's power waxes so strongly that it can no longer be contained within the Realms of Chaos. Storms howl outwards from the polar gates, driving his servants onwards to commit countless unspeakable acts in his name.
And all the men and women merely playthings for the Daemonettes.

The Dark Prince's power waxes so strongly that it can no longer be contained within the Realms of Chaos. Storms howl outwards from the polar gates, driving his servants onwards to commit countless unspeakable acts in his name.
Let the arrogant fools indulge themselves in fine liquors, exotic sweetmeats and the pleasures of the flesh. Then they shall feast again, and indulge in pleasures of a different sort...
Aenarion's final humiliation is at hand. Vengeance never tasted so sweet...
Skarbrand's anguished soul now writhes within the Witstealer, granting the blade unparalleled strength.
Open your hearts to the Flesh-Tempter! No, literally...

Arkhan journeys across the dunes, enslaving Tomb Kings from every dynasty and binding their legions to his will. Those who resist are destroyed utterly - their powdered bones lost to the sands of time forevermore.
These bloodthirsty creatures will make fine foot soldiers in the wars to come. Let their blight curse the lands.
Foremost of the Dark Lords, Arkhan heralds in a new age of death and despair.

Was this Tzeentch's ultimate goal, or merely one further step towards another end? To even begin to unravel his intentions is to invite madness, for perhaps he is mad himself, and his plans are, in fact, utterly devoid of all reason.

The Plaguefather now languishes within the Forge of Souls, his soul the plaything of the daemonsmiths. Without his meddlesome interference, Nurgle's festering gardens swifly decay down to nothing, supplanted by crystalline structures which burst forth from the parched earth.

localised_title: The Twelve Artefacts of Gilles le Breton
localised_description: Though most of the artefacts have been sent to the Impossible Fortress for his master's inscrutable designs, others have been kept for the Fateweaver's personal use in combat.

Though the Lizardmen of the present era had little understanding of these ancient relics, Kairos had long studied their purpose within the Impossible Fortress. His mastery of their magics rivals even those of a first generation Slann.
Fate has been rewritten. Those who were once destined to defeat Kairos now lie dead beneath his claws, their arcane baubles serving only for his entertainment. All is as was foreseen...

Tzeentch's forces now control the Wu Xing Compass. This powerful artefact was once used to protect the people of Cathay. Now, it is utilised as a weapon of war, unleashing fearsome magics upon those it once safeguarded.
The icy rock fortresses thrum with dead energies, and those willing to draw upon such foul powers will sweep down from the mountains with death in their eyes!
The plains of the Bretonnians lay covered in a sea of their bones, latent, still, awaiting the call to serve the Lichemaster.

localised_title: Age of the Living is Ending
localised_description: Men once sat on their proud stone thrones, surrounded by Counts in their great and expansive Empire. Now their capitals lie empty, razed to rubble, or quiet and filled with the dead. Their Emperor no-where to be seen.
Wounded once, driven to madness after a duel of three days and nights, Kemmler knew defeat. Not again shall he feel such weakness, his immortality now absolute.
Necromancers flock to his banner in Nagash's absence. Heinrich Kemmler's power permeates the very air around him, and the Necromancers grow ever stronger in his midst.
Built from the fused remains of a dozen conquered Tomb Kings, this monolith throbs with unholy power.

This land is my home, my birthright. The wind and rain are my allies. The trees and stones are my foot soldiers. The very earth will rise up against you should you try to take it from me. And my people will feast on your bones.
Nagash was a fool, too weak to see his dreams realised. I will build an empire of death atop his broken legacy.
From Nuln to Nordland, all pay the blood tithe and live only to serve the von Carsteins.
The portal is sealed, and the Daemons denied passage into this world. Now cleansed of all malice, the forest of Naggaroth can be bound to Athel Loren. The Weave of life and death grows ever stronger!

The Mage Queen stayed her hand in ages past. Her Heralds did not make the same mistake. Morathi is dead. Her Dark Covent unmade. Her Tower of Prophecy torn down to its foundations. Let the world be free of her scheming at last.
With the Hammer of Vaul and Caledor's volcanic furnaces at his disposal, Lord Daith's creations now rival those of the God of Smiths himself.
Whether venturing through the Old World or the New, all men should know to fear the forests.

Within the Everqueen's Grove, Alarielle reigns upon her Oaken Throne. With the passing of the seasons her body withers and the roots pierce deeper into her flesh, but Athel Avelorn thrives. Such is Isha's will.
